title: Curto Marco 2011 Arborina Riserva  (Barolo)
description: Truffle, new leather, pressed blue flower, menthol and a whiff of game lead the way. The aromas carry over to the ripe, full-bodied palate along with fleshy black cherry, steeped prune, cinnamon and star anise. Buffed tannins provide the framework. It's already accessible but will maintain well for the next several years. Drink through 2023.

title: Davies 2015 Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: This lovely wine has a baked aspect to the fruit that makes it warm and welcoming. It's otherwise edgy in high-toned characteristics of rhubarb, cranberry, orange and forest floor, with bolts of cardamom throughout. Complex, the oak is prominent yet integrated.

title: Dolin 2015 Chardonnay (Malibu-Newton Canyon)
description: Elliott Dolin's wines continue to make the strongest case for the potential of Malibu viticulture. This bottling shows rounded aromas of lemon rind, white peach, tangerine and a touch of butter. There is great energy and grip on the sip, where nectarine flavors meet with sea salt and sandalwood.

title: Domaine de la Bonne Tonne 2016 Les Charmes  (Morgon)
description: Aged for a short period in large wooden barrels, this wine comes from organically grown grapes and has a smooth texture. It emphasizes the pure, clean fruit and brings out the tannins for aging potential. Drink from 2019.

title: Casa Smith 2015 Cervo Northridge Vineyard Barbera (Wahluke Slope)
description: The aromas leap up out of the glass, with exquisite notes of plum, spice and cherry cream. On the palate, it's rich with soft fruit flavors, showing ripeness but still maintaining its balance, with the neutral oak aging bringing an aching sense of purity. Candied-cherry notes linger on the finish. It's a whole lot of wine for the money, with a big yum factor.

title: Chamonix 2015 Feldspar Pinot Noir (Franschhoek)
description: Herbal notes of menthol, garrigue and blackcurrant leaf are upfront on the bouquet of this wine, supported by red forest-berry fruits. Medium in weight and body, it offers fine yet present tannins that frame the red currant, strawberry and rhubarb fruit. Hints of sous bois and spicy oak dance on the earthy finish. Drink now–2023.

title: Charles Smith 2014 Broncho Stoneridge Vineyard Malbec (Washington)
description: The aromas erupt from the glass, with notes of potpourri, orange peel, moist earth, stem and garden herb. The palate shows a pleasing mix of earth and savory flavors that deliver a lot of elegance and intertwine effortlessly through the finish. The variety seems a bit hard to find but the expression is quite intriguing.

title: Château de Juliénas 2015 Cuvée Tradition  (Juliénas)
description: Firm and with great poise, this ripe wine has benefitted from the ripe vintage. It is succulent, balanced between poised tannins and the black-cherry fruits. This rich wine is ready to drink.

title: Château des Tours 2016  Brouilly
description: This estate has been vastly improved since it was bought by the Richard family whose coffees are familiar in many French cafés. Richly aromatic and juicy, this wine is full, packed with fruit and acidity, and already delicious to drink.

title: Château du Trignon 2016 Marsanne (Côtes du Rhône)
description: Plumes of honeysuckle, citrus peel and spice perfume this vibrant varietal Marsanne. It's medium to full in body but feels spry and fresh, boasting crisp pink grapefruit and guava flavors. Drink now through 2020 to enjoy its youthful appeal.

title: Adelaida 2015 HMR Estate Vineyard Pinot Noir (Adelaida District)
description: Paso Robles isn't known for Pinot Noir, although this historic vineyard has been growing it successfully, and with plenty of aging ability, since 1964. Aromas of light berries, tarragon and sandalwood lead into a palate full of mint, fennel pollen, mulberry and dried plum, altogether exhibiting a li hing mui sort of character.

title: Agustinos 2014 Escorial Limited Selection Cabernet Sauvignon (Maipo Valley)
description: An opaque purple color and rich aromas of prune and raisin announce a massive wine in which the raw materials were pushed to the extreme. Ripeness is maxed out on the flavor profile, which is dark, lush and emphasizes blackberry and raisin. Chewy heavy wines like this may not be in fashion any more, but this is still commendable for that style. Drink through 2021.

title: Badia a Coltibuono 2013 Riserva  (Chianti Classico)
description: Aromas of iris, tilled soil, new leather, chopped mint and ground clove take shape in the glass. The vibrant, austere palate delivers Marasca cherry, cranberry, espresso and a toasted note while a hint of tobacco marks the close. Close-grained tannins provide assertive support. Give this time to fully develop. Drink 2021–2031.

title: Domaine du Vieux Lazaret 2014 White (Châteauneuf-du-Pape)
description: A kiss of honey extends from nose to finish, accenting fresh apple and grapefruit flavors in this plush, full-bodied white. It's brawny and expansive on the palate, but sunny lemon acidity cuts through the fat, adding freshness to a lingering finish.

title: Domaine Guenaël Jambon 2016 Côte du Py Cuvée Nature  (Morgon)
description: This wine is big, rich and bold. Its black fruits and tight acidity indicate the aging potential of this wine. Add in the firm tannins and mineral texture, and it will take time to mature. Drink this dense wine from 2019

title: Domaine Marc Delienne 2016 Abbaye Road  (Fleurie)
description: Producer Marc Delienne, fresh from Paris, has made an impression with his three cuvées of Fleurie. Aged in wood, this rich, concentrated wine has density and great power. Tannins and dark fruits promise aging potential. Drink this wine from late 2018.

title: Duckhorn 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Dusty plum, tobacco and dark chocolate play against a soft texture in this varietal wine with a Merlot-like sensibility. Black and red currant and cherry mix well on the fruity palate, seasoned in appropriate measures of cedar, black pepper and clove.

title: E. Guigal 2013  Gigondas
description: Ripe, juicy cassis and blackberry notes seduce from nose to finish here. It's a brawny, rather lavish wine, both in body and fruit, but nuanced too, accentuated by hints of garrigue, leather and earth. Richly concentrated and long on the finish, it's framed neatly by fine, persistent tannins.

title: Eric Kent 2014 Las Madres Vineyard Syrah (Carneros)
description: Sanguine and smoky, this wine has a welcome herbal component that keeps it fresh and complex in the glass. Thick and densely concentrated in blackberry and plum, it persists in an underlying vibrancy that helps balance and complement its more luxurious tease of dark chocolate.

title: Ferrari-Carano 2013 Tresor Red (Sonoma County)
description: This classically styled Cabernet Sauvignon-driven blend shows power and structure in equal measure, with a backbone of integrated oak. Raspberry, black cherry and cassis flavors are succulently displayed along a carpet of thick concentrated richness.

title: Gård 2014 Lawrence Vineyards Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: The aromas show nuance, with notes of toast, assorted dried herb, cherry and plum. The fruit flavors are seamless in feel, showing concentration and depth. It's thoroughly enchanting.

title: Georges Duboeuf 2016 Château des Capitans Estate Bottled  (Juliénas)
description: With its Burgundy-colored tile roof and porticoed facade, this is a showpiece estate in Juliénas. The wine it produces is dense, with solid, complex tannins. Ripe red fruits plus acidity and a core of dryness will allow it to age. Drink from late 2018.

title: Geyser Peak 2013 Reserve Alexandre Winemaker's Reserve Meritage (Alexander Valley)
description: Fully concentrated in dusty black fruit and tobacco, this blends 79% Cabernet Sauvignon, 15% Petit Verdot, 3% Merlot, 2% Malbec and 1% Cabernet Franc. Mellowed in terms of ripeness and body weight, it offers sizable tannins that provide structure along the midpalate.

title: K Vintners 2015 Powerline Vineyard Viognier (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
description: The aromas explode with notes of honeysuckle, ripe peach, apricot and creamsicle. The flavors are supremely rich but also show a beautiful sense of delicacy along with a pronounced finish. It's full bore but delicious.

title: Lagar de Bezana 2014 Edición Limitada Syrah (Cachapoal Valley)
description: Ripe black-fruit aromas are nicely toasted and subtle. On the palate, this is chewy and concentrated but not too heavy. Darkchocolaty oaky blackberry flavors are just spicy and feral enough to let you know this is Syrah. As a whole, this is smooth and ready to drink.

title: Landmark 2015 La Encantada Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: There's a potent smoky character on the nose of this bottling, with hickory and oak aromas wrapped around the strawberry and plum flavors. The palate is fresher in a note of red plum, yet smoke, salt, peppercorn and oregano tones pervade. It's savory without being rich, showing a strong backbone of acidity.

title: Laurenz V. 2016 Charming Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)
description: Appetizing notes of green and yellow pear and even a touch of yellow plum play on the nose of this wine. The palate has that varietal, textured backdrop, but pear, plum and fresh, ripe lemon notes take center stage. It's concentrated and fruity, with a citrusy finish.

title: Lumen 2015 Pinot Noir (Santa Barbara County)
description: Light in the glass, this bottling by Winemaker Lane Tanner offers plum, red cherry, baked earth, shredded slate and a hint of vanilla-laced croissant on the nose. The palate shows energetic acidity and a grippy texture, with underripe strawberry, plum skin and green-peppercorn tones.

title: LXV 2015 Bootjack Ranch Reserve Cabernet Franc (Paso Robles)
description: Cherry syrup and a roasted meat element are revealed the nose of this bottling from a winery with a popular tasting room in downtown Paso Robles. Vanilla and baked good flavors show right away on the palate, where chalky tannins and rich cherry fruits arise mid-sip to ride a bountiful acidity and touch of pepper spice into the finish.

title: Markus Huber 2016 Ried Alte Setzen Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Traisental)
description: Zesty freshness and lemon brightness characterize the nose and palate of this slender, sinuous wine. Herbal savor tinges the edges while ripe pear fruit comes to the fore. Lovely, lively and wonderfully taut.
